topic_metadata.title: Why is my heading not showing properly?

posts.name: Andrew van der Spuy
posts.cooked: I have just begun with Typst. I typed “=Mytitle” in the left-hand page, but the typeset heading did not appear in the right-hand page. Instead, it simply showed “= Mytitle”. What has gone wrong?
posts.raw: I have just begun with Typst. I typed "=Mytitle" in the left-hand page, but the typeset heading did not appear in the right-hand page. Instead, it simply showed "= Mytitle". What has gone wrong?

posts.cooked:
I might be a missing space after the =? The documentation says:

Headings have dedicated syntax: They can be created by starting a line with one or multiple equals signs, followed by a space.

So this should work:

= Mytitle
posts.raw:
I might be a missing space after the `=`? The [documentation](https://typst.app/docs/reference/model/heading/#syntax) says:
> Headings have dedicated syntax: They can be created by starting a line with one or multiple equals signs, **followed by a space**.

So this should work:
```typst
= Mytitle
```

posts.name: Andrew van der Spuy
posts.cooked:
Thanks! It worked.

Blockquote
